titleStmt.title: Sample Transcription and Encoding Guidelines for the Stationers' Register Online
titleStmt.author: James Cummings
Pip Willcox

availability.p: This TEI ODD file is available under a Creative Commons Attribution license.

sourceDesc.p: ODD initially created on 11 August 2011 in Oxford by James Cummings; Guideline prose mostly written by Pip Willcox

revisionDesc.change: Added in Prose written by Pip tweaking some of it

body.head: Sample Transcription and Encoding Guidelines for the Stationers' Register Online
body.p: These sample transcription and encoding Guidelines for the Stationers' Register Online project are derived from a TEI P5 ODD XML file acting as documentation and meta-schema. The examples and notes in the appendices may refer to elements which are not included or have been renamed in this version. The prose and examples in the main encoding Guidelnes should be considered more accurate and normative.

div.head: Inclusions
div.p: The following sample pages should be transcribed. Please note that they are edge cases, and deliberately chosen to test our schema: the majority of the transcription will involve less problematic encoding.

p.bibl: Arber, Edward, A Transcript of the Registers of the Company of Stationers 1554-1640 AD, 5 vols, (London & Birmingham, 1875).

div.head: Metadata
div.p: Each file should include a header TEI header, which will include information on the source and creation of that file. It should include t title and ab anonymous block elements (see below).

div.head: Spelling, special characters and punctuation
div.p: Transcribe each character as it appears on the page, without correcting or regularizing spelling. Selected special characters are to be transcribed with standard Unicode entity references. Transcribe typographical ligatures (e.g. “ct", “fl") as separate letters; transcribe diphthong ligatures, (e.g. “œ" “æ") with Unicode character entity references (see below). Punctuation should be transcribed as it appears, with virgules transcribed as “/".

div.head: Leading dots
div.p: Leading dots should not be transcribed.

div.head: Gaps in the text
div.p: Gaps fall into two main categories: points where Arber notes he has not transcribed something that appears in the original manuscript; and spaces where something that is expected does not appear.
The former should be captured in gp gap elements.

egXML.gp: [This page is entirely blank in the Original.]

div.p: Many of these gaps follow a standard form, e.g. “[Four entries omitted.]". Where this is the case, please record the missing entries with an n number attribute in the gp gap element.
Spaces should be marked with a spc space element, for example where in an item in a list that should contain a sum is missing: “Summa totalis ____"
Note that the spc space element can include contents.

div.head: Hyphenation
div.p: Soft hyphens (i.e. those that simply indicate that a word has been split across a line or page) should be transcribed using the Unicode reference ­. Hard hyphens that indicate an actual hyphenated word, whether occurring inline or at the end of a line, should be transcribed as Unicode ‐.

div.head: Bracketing
div.p: Curly brackets, “{…}", are often used to group the items of a list together. They should be noted in the encoding as a rend attribute in the appropriate element, e.g. ls list, p paragraph (see below for details of these elements). The r rend values of 'brr' (bracketed right) and 'brl' (bracketed left) are provided for this purpose.
Square brackets “[…]" are used to denote an editorial intervention by Arber. These should be transcribed where they appear as “[" or “]".

div.head: Superscript and subscript text
div.p: The most common superscript text is the superscript li, s, d or ob, denoting currency. These should be captured as plain text, without marking the fact of their superscription. For further explanation of transcribing sums of money, see below.

All other superscript text, and subscript text, should be tagged where possible using a r rend attribute in a surrounding element, or in the absence of another element, using a h highlighting element with a r rend attribute (see below).

div.head: Decorative features
div.p: The presence of decorative features, such as dropped capitals, decorative borders or illustrations should be noted with a r rend attribute values, where possible, or a gr graphic element (see below).

div.head: Page layout
div.p: Encoding the layout of these volumes is important as Arber includes information in his choice of fonts that is not otherwise made explicit.

div.head: Page, line and column breaks
div.p: Page breaks should be noted inside fw forme work elements, in pb page break elements with n attribute values with any spaces removed.

Line breaks lb/ should be noted where there is a line break which is not caused by reaching the edge of the text block, and where the break is not indicated by a closing structural element, e.g. /p paragraph, /hd heading.
Column breaks, for example in lists, should always be noted using cb/ elements.

div.head: Highlighting
div.p: Where the size or type of font differs from the usual Roman, this should be recorded as a r rend attribute in a surrounding element, where possible. Where there is no suitable surrounding element, the change should be recorded in h highlighting elements, with an appropriate r rend attribute value (see below).

egXML.p: Recevyd of Roberte Robyns for his admyttinge freman of this howse the xj of februarij 1570 [i.e. 1571] iijs iiijd

div.p: Note that the font used for names in particular is important (see below for details).

Where text appears in a different size from normal, either smaller or larger, this should be encoded in the surrounding elements where possible, and where there are no appropriate elements, in h highlighting elements.

Exceptions
Inside square brackets, which denote an editorial intervention by Arber, only changes in font need be indicated: if an entire note appears in italics, this should not be recorded; if a note contains a change of font, this should be recorded.

div.head: Forme work
div.p: The forme work at the head and foot of a page should be transcribed.

Typically, the head forme work will contain a dt date, a folio number, which should be transcribed in pb/ page break elements, and a group of names, which should be transcribed in a discrete seg segment element containing as appropriate ls list and it item elements, n name, fn forename and sn surname elements. It may also contain an alternative date (for example, a regnal year) and one or more editorial notes, marked by square brackets.

egXML.fw:
[Continued from page 672.] [ G. Cawood L. Binge.
R. Watkins.] 1594 [i.e. 10—17 March 1595] Anno 37o Regni Regin[a]e Elizabeth[æ]/

div.p: Typically the foot forme work will contain a volume and page number, which should be transcribed in fw forme work and pb/ page break elements.
Note that each page will therefore contain two pb page break elements one at the start and one at the finish.
Please note that paratextual information relating to Arber’s edition should not be transcribed, e.g. the catchwords “A TRANSCRIPT &C." and signatures “21".

div.head: File, header and body
div.p: Each page of the sample, and each complete volume, should be transcribed discretely, in file file elements.
Each file should contain a header TEI header, which should contain basic information about the text, and a body body, which will contain the text itself.

div.head: Textual divisions
div.p: The body should contain nested d textual divisions elements, all of which should include t type attributes which described the content of the individual division. See below for a complete list of t type values for the d element.

list.label: accounts
list.item: A division containing a list of accounts
list.label: apprentices
list.item: A division containing a list of apprentices
list.label: charges
list.item: A division containing a list of charges
list.label: charters
list.item: A division containing a list of charters
list.label: dinners
list.item: A division containing a list of dinners
list.label: entries
list.item: A division containing a list or sub-list of entries
list.label: e
fines
list.item: A division containing a list of fines
list.label: freemen
list.item: A division containing a list of freemen
list.label: gifts
list.item: A division containing a list of gifts
list.label: misc
list.item: A division containing a list of misc
list.label: other
payments
list.item: A division containing a list of payments
list.label: receipts
list.item: A division containing a list of receipts
list.label: year
list.item: A division containing a year in the register

div.head: Headings
div.p: Headings and sub-headings in the text should be transcribed in hd heading elements, with t type values of “sub" as appropriate, at the beginning of the relevant d division or ls list.

Note that headings may appear in the margins, rather than above the body of a d division or ls list. This is particularly common in lists of book license entries where the names of licensees appear in the left margin.

d.p: Recevyd of Alexandre lacy for his lycense for pryntinge of a ballet intituled the lamentation to [a] frynde of of his iiijd

div.head: Paragraphs and lists
div.p: Text should be transcribed in p paragraph elements wherever possible, including where the function of the block of text appears to have a discrete function, e.g. a signature. Where the text appears to be line-delimited by something other than the edge of the text block, please note line breaks with lb/ line beginning elements. Where text clearly forms part of a list, please use ls list elements containing it item elements, rather than p paragraph elements.

div.head: Tables
div.p: Where possible, transcribe information set out in tabular form (for example lists including right-justified sums of money) in ls list and it item elements, and cb/ column break elements, as appropriate. Where this is not possible, please transcribe tabular information in tbl table and cell cell elements.

div.head: Names
div.p: Where people and place names appear in the text, they should be transcribed in n name elements, and include fn forename (including initials) and sn surname elements as appropriate. n name elements should be used for all names that are recognized, whether fictional, mythological, historical or contemporary. Titles and ranks should be included inside n name elements.
Small capitals should be recorded in the r attribute, but transcribed in mixed case to preserve capital initial letters.

The default assumption is that a n name element will be used to mark aperson's name. If the n name element marks the name of a place or another entity a t type should be included. Valid t type attribute values are 'pla' and 'other', for 'place' and 'other' respectively.

div.head: Dates
div.p: Dates should be encoded wherever they appear in dt date elements. dt date elements can include date ranges (usually separated by an em-dash). These may also be regnal years or other textual date expressions.

div.head: Numbers
div.p: Roman and Arabic numerals should be transcribed in nm number elements. If the number has multiple parts (e.g. shillings and pence separated by a space) these should be transcribed all in a single nm element.
Typically at the end of each book license entry is a sum of money, justified right after leading dots.

Note that the d (or l, li, s or ob) should be included in the nm number element, and that its superscription should not be encoded (see above). Note also that leading dots should not be transcribed (see above).

Exceptions
Where something other than, or in addition to, a sum of money appears, please transcribe the complete phrase in seg segment elements.

div.head: Book titles
div.p: The majority of these volumes are lists of licenses to print books. Typically the title of the book appears in each entry. These titles should be transcribed in t title elements, with r rend attributes as appropriate.

egXML.p: Recevyd of Alexandre lacy for his lycense for pryntinge of a ballet intituled the lamentation to [a] frynde of of his iiijd

div.head: Marginal Notes
div.p: Marginal Notes should be transcribed in add addition elements, with r rend attributes as appropriate. This includes marginal notes, but excludes any of Arber's notes that are already marked through the use of square brackets.

div.head: Quotations
div.p: Where quotations are marked in the text, transcribe them in q quotation elements.

div.head: Illustrations, figures or graphics
div.p: Where illustrations, figures of graphics appear in the text, encode their presence in an empty gr/ graphic element.

div.head: Foreign (non-Roman) alphabets
div.p: Where text appears in a non-Roman alphabet, encode its presence in an empty for/ foreign element.

div.head: Unclear, illegible or problematic passages
div.p: Where a passage is unclear or illegible in the PDF image, please capture it in un unclear elements. Where a passage is problematic for a reason other than legibility, for example where the appropriate tagging cannot be understood, please surround it with nt note elements. If further explanation is necessary, please include it as a <!-- comment --> comment

div.head: Example header TEI header
div.p: A space for title and basic metadata is provided but it is expected that this will be of a minimal nature as below.

header.ab: Digital image of Volume One folio 14v of Arber, Edward, A Transcript of the Registers of the Company of Stationers 1554-1640 AD, 5 vols, (London & Birmingham, 1875).
Prepared as a sample for the Stationer’s Register Online project.

div.head: Unicode character reference entities
div.p: For entities other than these, please use Unicode character reference entities, and mark them with nt to draw our attention to them.

list.label: ab
al
ar
b
bel
bl
brl
list.item: rendering is bracketed to the left
list.label: brr
list.item: rendering is bracketed to the right
list.label: c
dc
list.item: rendered as drop-cap or illuminated initial
list.label: f
i
l
lrg
med
n
o
r
rm
s
sc
sig
sml
st
u
xlrg
xxlrg

file.header:
<!-- title --> Excerpt from the Stationers' Register <!-- other simply classified metadata notes -->
Digital image of folio 183b, scanned by Ian Gadd. Arber, Edward, A Transcript of the Registers of the Company of Stationers 1554-1640 AD, 5 vols, (London & Birmingham, 1875).
Prepared as a sizing sample for Giles Bergel and Ian Gadd for their Stationers' Company project.
file.body:
<!-- more years --> <!-- new page --> [
22 July 1569 -- 22 July 1570.
R. Jugge . J. Walley. W. Norton.
] <!-- group of entries --> <!-- Blackletter heading --> The enterynge of Copyes <!-- an entry --> <!-- header rendered left, surname in bold --> purfoote <!-- paragraph of entry -->
Recevyd of <!-- bold forename and surname --> Thomas purfoote for his lycense for the prynting of <!-- title with small caps highlighted section --> an history of Nostagio <!-- amount of payment in roman numerals 'rm' and aligned right 'ar' --> iiijd
L haryson and bisshope
Recevyd of lucas haryson and george besshope for thayre lycense for pryntinge of a boke Hummengious postle [authorized] by [my] lorde of London iiijd
bynnyman
Recevyd of henry bynnyman for his lycense for pryntinge of a boke epistola cambrigienses [authorized] by ye lorde of Canterbury iiijd
bynnyman
Recevyd of henry bynnyman for his lycense for the pryntinge of a boke intituled theatrie or mirror vjd
[This was John Vander Noodt's Theatre &c., containing the earliest known printed productions of Edmund Spenser.]
Rychard Jonnes
Recevyd of Rychard Jonnes for his lycense for pryntinge of a ballett intituled example of chastite iiijd
alde
Recevyd of John alde for his lycense for pryntinge of a ballett intituled the trubles of Josephus vjd
alde
Recevyd of John alde for his lycense for pryntinge of a ballett intituled as Wyllowe for payne hath bene Counted of late iiijd
Barker
Recevyd of Christofer Barker for his lycense for prynting of serten prayers of my Lady TYRWETT viijd
[This is the earliest work entered for this celebrated printer. He was not at this time a member of the Stationers' Company, and did not now keep a printing press, see p. 111: so that he appears here only as a publisher. He became Printer to the Queen about the 16th September 1577.]
Barker
Recevyd of Crestofer Barker for his lycense for pryntinge of serten prayers of master Bullion iiijd
Colwell
Recevyd of Thomas Colwell for his lycense for pryntinge of an enterlude for boyes to handle and to passe tyme at christinmas iiijd
T marshe
Recevyd of Thomas marshe for his lycense for pryntinge of a boke intituled the Turkes Cerymonyes iiijd <!-- end of entries div --> <!-- Closing page footer -->
<!-- more pages -->

div.head: Formal TEI_corset specification
div.p: This specification is based on the TEI P5 Guidelines, however it renames standard TEI elements and removes or constrains a great deal of the Guidelines. However, the examples and notes below may refer to the original element names or aspects of the TEI not present in this schema. They are provided as additional (generated) reference material only. The prose and examples in the encoding guidelines above should be considered more accurate and normative.

moduleRef.include: abbr add cb date foreign gap graphic head hi item label lb list name note num p pb q title unclear

valItem.desc: A division containing a list of accounts
A division containing a list of apprentices
A division containing a list of charges
A division containing a list of charters
A division containing a list of dinners
A division containing a specified set of dates
A division containing a list or sub-list of entries
A division containing a list of fines
A division containing a list of freemen
A division containing a list of gifts
A division containing a list of misc
A division containing a list of payments
A division containing a list of receipts
A division containing a year in the register

remarks.p: d elements are required to have a t attribute.

valItem.desc: rendering is bracketed to the left
rendering is bracketed to the right
rendered as drop-cap or illuminated initial
